page.title: 13WORSLEY POOL
page.content: WORSLEY POOL The new Worsley Pool was opened in 1974 and the old baths was made into two small teaching pools.The large pool is 25 metres by 12 metres and is 2 metres deep.It costs 32p for an adult, 16p for children and 10p for spectators.Six and a half thousand people use the pool each week and 700 of these have lessons.Three hundred and fifty children belong to the swimming club and there is coaching tuition for promising swimmers.There is also a sauna, solarium and an aerotone and a weight training room has just opened.The Worsley Sub Aqua Club meets at the baths once a week.We go from school once a week for a swimming lesson.In the entrance hall there is now a pool table, juke box and several video machines. BY ANDREW HAYFIELD
